title: Glorious Tourist Attraction in Ladakh
text:
Travel Articles | July 31, 2015 
Ladakh, a pleasant destination of India, is placed at Leh District. Situated in the midst of the Great Himalayas, this place attracts you close to see nature and rejuvenating your sense. 
Nature attraction of Ladakh is a treatment to the eyes. You can begin with a visit to the charming Pangong Lake. 
When nature calls, Choose Ladakh 
In which waters like mirror is placed at a height of 14,270 feet. Image of the mountains in the crystalline water increase the beauty of the spot. 
One another crisp water lake here named Tso Moriri, situated at a height of 15,000 feet. During travel from Leh to Tso Moriri, the wonderful green scene appears to refreshment. There is also attractive Waterfall here. 
Zanskar Valley is a place to spend some time. Peace and peacefulness is noticeable all around and waters of the valley, placed between the Himalayas and Zanskar mountain ranges. 
For flowers lover, the Nubra Valley is a marvels place. Photographer feels in paradise with colourful flower of Nubra Valley. 
The Mystical Ladakh 
Ladakh is mysterious and playful at the snowy. Mysterious Magnetic hill situated on the way to Baltik from Kargil. Magnetic hill can pull any vehicle up. 
Ladakh- Place of Buddhism 
The Shanti Stupa is the most famous Buddhist monastery of Ladakh, situated at a tremendous altitude of 4267 meters. 
The most seasoned Tibetan religious monastery "Lamayuru" is stand at the altitude of 3510 meters. Explore here peaceful life of the Buddhist monastery. Here is more to learn about Buddhism, also enjoy colourful wall painting and murals. 
Alchi Monastery is very popular monastery is stand at the bank of Indus River. Shey Monastery is popular for the blue haired Maitreya Buddha statue. 17.5 meters high this statue is made of Copper and brass. 
There are more famous pilgrimages of Ladakh like thiskey, Diskit, Hemis monasteries. 
Adventures of Ladakh 
The Royal Leh Palace is your next tour destination . This 17th century regal home is a nine storied building, from where you can appreciate all encompassing perspective of Leh and the sprawling Indus River. This royal residence now has an exhibition hall where you can look at obsolescent like regal crowns, dresses, jewelleries and adornments. 
If you are infatuated with mountains, appreciate a camel safari or Yak ride through the high mountains. Explore the differing topography of the spot with trekking on the uneven place of Ladakh.
